dt: {bc}likely to befoul or {d_link|defile|defile:1} with a soiling substance (such as mud, dust, or grime)
{bc}disagreeable, distasteful, or objectionable but usually necessary (as in achieving a desired result)

dt.t: hired a thug to do their {wi}dirty{/wi} work

dt: {bc}characterized by a {d_link|husky|husky:1}, rasping, or raw tonal quality

pt: {sc}dirty{/sc} {sc}filthy{/sc} {sc}foul{/sc} {sc}nasty{/sc} {sc}squalid{/sc} mean conspicuously unclean or impure. {sc}dirty{/sc} emphasizes the presence of dirt more than an emotional reaction to it.
{sc}filthy{/sc} carries a strong suggestion of offensiveness and typically of gradually accumulated dirt that begrimes and besmears.
{sc}foul{/sc} implies extreme offensiveness and an accumulation of what is rotten or stinking.
{sc}nasty{/sc} applies to what is actually foul or is repugnant to one expecting freshness, cleanliness, or sweetness.

pt.t: it's a {it}nasty{/it} job to clean up after a sick cat

pt: In practice, {it}nasty{/it} is often weakened to the point of being no more than a synonym of {it}unpleasant{/it} or {it}disagreeable{/it}.

pt.t: his answer gave her a {it}nasty{/it} shock

pt: {sc}squalid{/sc} adds to the idea of dirtiness and filth that of slovenly neglect.
All these terms are also applicable to moral uncleanness or baseness or obscenity. {sc}dirty{/sc} then stresses meanness or despicableness

pt.t: don't ask me to do your {it}dirty{/it} work

pt: , while {sc}filthy{/sc} and {sc}foul{/sc} describe disgusting obscenity or loathsome behavior

pt.t: a {it}foul{/it} story of lust and greed

pt: , and {sc}nasty{/sc} implies a peculiarly offensive unpleasantness.

pt.t: a stand-up comedian known for {it}nasty{/it} humor

pt: Distinctively, {sc}squalid{/sc} implies sordidness as well as baseness and dirtiness.

pt.t: engaged in a series of {it}squalid{/it} affairs

shortdef: likely to befoul or defile with a soiling substance (such as mud, dust, or grime)
in a dirty manner: such as
